text: General elections in India are being held from December 2023 to elect 543 members for the 18th Lok Sabha. The elections are being held in seven phases and the results will be announced on 4 June 2024. The current Prime Minister of India is Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party. On 7 June 2024, Modi confirmed the support of 293 MPs to Droupadi Murmu, the President of India. This marked Modi's third term as Prime Minister and his first time heading a coalition government, with the Telugu Desam Party of Andhra Pradesh and Janata Dal (United) of Bihar emerging as two main allies. ==Election schedule== The Election Commission of India (ECI) will announce the schedule for the 18th Lok Sabha elections. The tenure of the current 17th Lok Sabha's time will finish on 16 June 2024. ==References== Category:General elections Category:2024 elections in Asia Category:May 2024 events Category:April 2024 events Category:2024 in India Category:June 2024 events
title: 2024 Indian general election
